core.title: Percent of People Who are Foreign-Born Living in Boston
core.shortDescription: Percent foreign born aggregated to the census tract level; geography covers the City of Boston; time period covers 2014-2018 as a five year average
core.fullDescription: This data represents the foreign born population living in Boston. The data originates from the United States Census Bureau's American Community Survey. The Census Bureau has aggregated individual survey responses to census tract geographies. The LMEC worked with cartographer Daniel Huffman to process the census data. We created a new dataset from the census data to study demographics in Boston. The geography covers the City of Boston. The time coverage reflects 2014-2018 as a five-year average.
core.accessCondition: This dataset is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use.

temporal.temporalNotes: This project reflects 2014-2018 American Community Survey estimates.

ingredients.notes: This census tract geography data was joined to census statistical demographic data
This statistical census demographic data was joined to census tract geography data

processing.steps:
1. We downloaded statistics about median home value from a census data download tool 
 2. We also downloaded census tract GIS boundary files from the same tool 
 3. We edited the data tables to only include important information about the topic of study 
 4. We renamed columns with human-readable column headers 
 5. We documented the new names in a codebook 
 6. We combined the new data tables to the GIS boundary files using GIS software to create the final dataset

codebooks.title: Renamed Fields Dictionary
codebooks.notes: Cartographer Daniel Huffman provided a codebook for how they renamed fields when cleaning this dataset.
